parameters.description:
An OAuth Access Token with scopes:
  • agreement_read
in the format 'Bearer {accessToken}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.
parameters.name: x-api-user

parameters.description: The userId or email in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. of the user that has shared his/her account
parameters.name: x-on-behalf-of-user

parameters.description: A query parameter to fetch all the hidden bulk send agreements along with the visible bulk send agreements. Default value is false.
parameters.name: showHiddenMegaSigns

parameters.description: Used to navigate through the pages. If not provided, returns the first page.
parameters.name: cursor

parameters.description: Number of intended items in the response page. If not provided, it is decided by the application settings.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The group identifier, as returned by the group creation API or retrieved from the API to fetch groups.
parameters.name: groupId

get.summary: Retrieves Send in Bulk parent agreements for a user.

An OAuth Access Token with scopes:
  • agreement_write
in the format 'Bearer {accessToken}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

parameters.description: The userId or email in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. of the user that has shared his/her account
parameters.name: x-on-behalf-of-user

post.description: This is a primary endpoint which is used to create a new bulk send. A bulk send can be created using transientDocument, libraryDocument or a URL. You can create a bulk send in AUTHORING state to prepare the document before send or in IN_PROCESS to immediately send it. You can use the PUT/megaSigns/{megaSignId}/state endpoint to transition the state of bulk send. An allowed transition would follow the following sequence: AUTHORING->IN_PROCESS -> CANCELLED.

requestBody.description: Information about the bulk send that you want to send.

post.summary: Send an agreement out for signature to multiple recipients. Each recipient will receive and sign their own copy of the agreement.

parameters.description:
An OAuth Access Token with scopes:
  • agreement_read - agreement read is always required
  • user_login - Required additionally if the autoLoginUser parameter is set to true
in the format 'Bearer {accessToken}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.
parameters.name: x-api-user

parameters.description: The userId or email in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. of the user that has shared his/her account
parameters.name: x-on-behalf-of-user

parameters.description: The identifier of the bulk send parent agreement, as returned by the bulk send creation API or retrieved from the API to fetch the bulk send agreements
parameters.name: megaSignId

requestBody.description: Name of the required view and its desired configuration.

post.summary: Retrieves the requested views of a bulk send agreement.

ReminderInfo.description: The information about a reminder associated with a recipient of an agreement.

email.description: The email address of the user

fullName.description: Full name of this account sharer.

permissions.description: A list of permissions given for this account sharing.

userId.description: A unique identifier of the user resource for REST APIs as issued by Acrobat Sign.

comment.description: An optional comment describing to the recipients why you want to cancel the transaction

notifyOthers.description: Whether or not you would like the recipients to be notified that the transaction has been cancelled. The default value is false

documentsImageUrlsInfo.description: A list of original document image URLs info.

source.description:
The source for the bulk participants.
- FILE: to reference file with participant defined in the ChildAgreementsInfo object.

email.description: Email of the participant. Currently only supports sender email.

bulkInfo.description: Info about the bulk participants corresponding to each child agreement of the bulk send

order.description: Index indicating position at which signing group needs to sign.Signing group to sign at first place is assigned a 1 index. Different signingOrder specified in input should form a valid consecutive increasing sequence of integers. Otherwise signing order will be considered invalid.

role.description: Role assumed by all members in the set.

company.description: Company of the CC participant, if available.

email.description: Email of the CC participant of the bulk send

hidden.description: True if the bulk send parent is hidden for the user that is calling the API. Only returned if self is true.

name.description: Name of the CC participant, if available.

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the CC participant of the bulk send.

self.description: True if the CC participant of the bulk send is the same user that is calling the API.

fileInfo.description: File info containing per child agreement information of bulk send.

autoLoginUser.description: Auto LogIn Flag. If true, the URL returned will automatically log the user in. If false, the URL returned will require the credentials. By default its value is false

frameParent.description: An optional field to provide the comma-separated list of parent domain urls where the returned URLs may be iframed. If provided with non-empty and valid list of parent domain urls, it will be used to allow framing for the same. By default the value is null and the Acrobat Sign pages will not be viewable in an iframe.

noChrome.description: No Chrome Flag. If true, the embedded page is shown without a navigation header or footer. If false, the standard page header and footer will be present. By default its value is false

company.description: The company of the participant, if available.

createdDate.description: The date when the participant was added. This will be returned as part of GET call but is ignored if passed as part of PUT call.

email.description: Email of the participant. This is the required field and will always be returned unless it is a fax workflow (legacy Send in Bulk) that were created using fax as input

hidden.description: True if the bulk send is hidden for the user that is calling the API. Only returned if self is true.

id.description: The unique identifier of the participant.

name.description: The name of the participant, if available.

privateMessage.description: The private message of the participant, if available. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

securityOption.description: Security options that apply to the participant.

self.description: True if this participant is the same user that is calling the API.

userId.description: The user ID of the participant. This will be returned as part of GET call but is ignored if passed as part of PUT call.

id.description: The unique identifier of the participant set.

memberInfos.description: Array of ParticipantInfo objects, containing participant-specific data (e.g. email). All participants in the array belong to the same set

name.description: Name of ParticipantSet (it can be empty, but needs not to be unique in a single bulk send). Maximum no of characters in participant set name is restricted to 255.

order.description: Index indicating sequential signing group (specified for hybrid routing).

privateMessage.description: Participant set's private message - all participants in the set will receive the same message.

role.description: Role assumed by all participants in the set (signer, approver etc.).

status.description: The bulk send status with respect to the participant set.

providerDesc.description: Digital Identity Gateway Provider Description. This will be ignored as part of POST or PUT calls.

providerId.description: Digital Identity Gateway Provider Id. When replacing a participant that has DIG_ID authentication specified, you must supply a provider id for the new participant.

providerName.description: Digital Identity Gateway Provider Name. This will be ignored as part of POST or PUT calls.

cloudProviderIp.description: Cloud Provider IP for digital signing

cloudProviderUrl.description: Cloud Provider URL for digital signing

company.description: Company name captured during digital signing

createdDate.description: The date the document was created

id.description: ID of the document. In case of PUT call, this is the only field that is accepted in Document structure. Name and mimeType are ignored in case of PUT call

mimeType.description: mimeType of the original file. This is returned in GET but not accepted back in PUT

name.description: Name of the original document uploaded. This is returned in GET but not accepted back in PUT

numPages.description: Number of pages in the document

imageSize.description: ImageSize corresponding to the imageUrl returned

imageURLs.description: A list of image url (one per page).

imagesAvailable.description: true if images for the associated image size is available, else false.

documentImageUrlsList.description: A list of documents image URLs.

id.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried. Note: the externalId value is visible to all participants through the API, so should not be used to contain a sensitive token.

ccs.description: A list of one or more CCs that will be copied in the bulk send transaction. The CCs will each receive an email at the beginning of the transaction and also when the final document is signed. The email addresses will also receive a copy of the document, attached as a PDF file

childAgreementsInfo.description: Info corresponding to each child agreement of the bulk send

createdDate.description: Date when bulk send was created. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

expirationTime.description: Time after which Agreement expires and needs to be signed before it. Format should be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation.

externalId.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried. Note: the externalId value is visible to all participants through the API, so should not be used to contain a sensitive token.

fileInfos.description: A list of one or more files (or references to files) that will be sent out for signature. If more than one file is provided, they will be combined into one PDF before being sent out. Note: Only one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified

firstReminderDelay.description:
Integer which specifies the delay in hours before sending the first reminder.
This is an optional field. The minimum value allowed is 1 hour and the maximum value cant be more than the difference of agreement creation and expiry time of the agreement in hours.
If this is not specified but the reminder frequency is specified, then the first reminder will be sent based on frequency.
i.e. if the reminder is created with frequency specified as daily, the firstReminderDelay will be 24 hours. Cannot be updated in a PUT

groupId.description: The unique identifier of the group to which the bulk send will belong to when it is created. If it is not provided during agreement creation the primary group of the creator will be used

id.description: The unique identifier of bulk send

isDocumentRetentionApplied.description: Is document retention applied for this resource.  If provided in POST or PUT, it will simply be ignored.

lastEventDate.description: The date of the last event that occurred for this bulk send.  Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

locale.description: The locale associated with this agreement - specifies the language for the signing page and emails, for example en_US or fr_FR. If none specified, defaults to the language configured for the agreement sender

message.description: An optional message to the participants, describing what is being sent or why their signature is required

name.description: The name of the agreement that will be used to identify it, in emails, website and other places

numChildren.description: The total number of bulk send children associated with the bulk send parent. If provided in POST, it will be ignored. If modified in PUT, it will throw error MODIFYING_IMMUTABLE_FIELDS

participantSetsInfo.description: Information about the bulk send participants set.

postSignOption.description: URL and associated properties for the success page the user will be taken to after completing the signing process

reminderFrequency.description: Optional parameter that sets how often you want to send reminders to the participants. If it is not specified, the default frequency set for the account will be used

securityOption.description: Optional security parameters for the bulk send

senderEmail.description: Email of agreement sender. Only provided in GET. Can not be provided in POST/PUT request. If provided in POST/PUT, it will be ignored

signatureType.description:
Specifies the type of signature you would like to request - written or e-signature. The possible values are
ESIGN : Agreement needs to be signed electronically
, WRITTEN : Agreement will be signed using handwritten signature and signed document will be uploaded into the system

vaultingInfo.description: Vaulting properties that allows Acrobat Sign to securely store documents with a vault provider

libraryDocumentId.description: ID for an existing Library document that will be added to the agreement

notarize.description: Indicates that this document needs to be notarized

transientDocumentId.description: ID for a transient document that will be added to the agreement

urlFileInfo.description: URL for an external document to add to the agreement

FormField.description: A form field for an agreement.

assignee.description: Who the field is assigned to. Valid values are a participant set id, null, "SIGNER", "SENDER", "NOBODY", "PREFILL" or "EVERYONE". If "SENDER" is specified, Sender Signs First/Last must also be defined (Sender is also a Signer of the bulk send). If set to a participant set id, then any member of that participant set may fill out the field. "NOBODY" indicates that the field may not be filled by anybody (e.g. autopopulated fields like transaction number). "PREFILL" indicates that the field will be filled by the sender before the agreement is sent out for signing. "EVERYONE" exists only in hyperlink fields currently and indicates that it is assigned to all participants. null indicates that anybody may fill out the field. If the property isn't specified, it is treated as null.

backgroundColor.description: Background color of the form field in RGB or HEX format

borderColor.description: Color of the border of the field in RGB or HEX format

borderStyle.description: Style of the border of the field.

borderWidth.description: Width of the border of the field in default user space units

calculated.description: true if this field's value is calculated from an expression, else false

conditionalAction.description: A predicate (or set of predicates) that determines whether this field is visible and enabled.

contentType.description: Content Type of the form field.

currency.description: A currency ISO code. Only applicable for payment form fields. Should be one of the currencies supported in the payment integration merchant accounts.

defaultValue.description: Default value of the form field

displayFormat.description: Format of the value of the field to be displayed based on the displayFormatType property.

displayFormatType.description: Format type of the text field.

displayLabel.description: Display label attached to the field

fontColor.description: Font color of the form field in RGB or HEX format

fontName.description: Font name of the form field

fontSize.description: Font size of the form field in points

hiddenOptions.description: Text values which are hidden in a drop down form field

hyperlink.description: Hyperlink-specific data (e.g. as url, link type)

inputType.description: Input type of the form field

locations.description: All locations in a document where the form field is placed

masked.description: true if the input entered by the signer has to be masked (like password), false if it shouldn't be

maskingText.description: Text to mask the masked form field

maxLength.description: Maximum length of the input text field in terms of no. of characters

maxValue.description: Upper bound of the number that can be entered by the signer

minLength.description: Minimum length of the input text field in terms of no. of characters

minValue.description: Lower bound of the number that can be entered by the signer

name.description: The name of the form field

radioCheckType.description: The type of radio button (if field is radio button, identified by inputType).

readOnly.description: true if it is a read-only field, else false

required.description: true if it is a mandatory field to be filled by the signer, else false

tooltip.description: Tooltip text for the form field

urlOverridable.description: For web form text fields only - true if the default value may come from the URL, else false

validation.description: Rule for validating the field value.

validationData.description: Further data for validating input with regards to the field's specified format. The contents and interpretation of formatData depends on the value of validation.

validationErrMsg.description: Error message to be shown to the signer if filled value doesn't match the validations of the form field

valueExpression.description: Expression to calculate value of the form field

visible.description: If set to false, then the form field is hidden.  Otherwise, it is visible.

visibleOptions.description: Text values which are visible in a drop down form field

FormFieldConditionPredicate.description: A predicate used to determine whether the condtion succeeds

fieldLocationIndex.description: Index of the location of the form field used in the predicate

fieldName.description: Name of the field whose value is the basis of predicate

operator.description: Operator to be applied on the value of the predicate field.

value.description: Value to compare against the value of the predicate's form field, using the specified operator

FormFieldConditionalAction.description: Conditional actions to perfom on this form field.

action.description: Action to show/hide the form field is to be taken on the basis of evaluation of conditions.

anyOrAll.description: It indicates if any one of the conditions or all of them have to be true.

predicates.description: The predicates to be evaluated in order to determine whether this condition is true

FormFieldHyperlink.description: Hyperlink-specific data for hyperlink form fields

documentLocation.description: Location on the document pointed by the link in case of INTERNAL type link

linkType.description: Type of link in an agreement.

url.description: URL, in case of EXTERNAL type link

height.description: Height of the form field in default user space units

left.description: No. of default user space units from left of the page for form field placement

pageNumber.description: Number of the page where form field has to be placed, starting from 1.

top.description: No. of default user space units from bottom of the page for form field placement

width.description: Width of the form field in default user space units

FormFieldPutInfo.description: Information required to add or replace agreement form fields

fields.description: The list of fields to update or replace.

displayDate.description: The display date for the bulk send parent agreement. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

esign.description: True, if the signature type of the bulk send parent agreement is ESIGN. False, if the signature type of the bulk send parent agreement is WRITTEN

hidden.description: True, if bulk send is hidden for the user

id.description: The unique identifier of the bulk send parent agreement

name.description: Name of the bulk send parent agreement

status.description: Current status of the bulk send parent agreement from the perspective of the user

email.description: Email of the CC participant of the bulk send.

displayDate.description: The display date for the agreement. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

esign.description: True if this is an e-sign document

id.description: The unique identifier of the agreement.If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

parentId.description: The parent id of a bulk send child *OR* the originating id of a web form agreement instance

status.description: This is a server generated attribute which provides the detailed status of an agreement with respect to the apiCaller

megaSignChildAgreementList.description: A array of bulk send child agreements

page.description: Pagination information for navigating through the response

childAgreementsInfoFileId.description: id of the file containg information about the existing childAgreementsInfo associated with the bulk send. Will be ignored in POST and PUT calls and in the case of GET call, this is the only thing that will be returned. The content of the file can be fetched through GET /megaSigns/{megaSignId}/childAgreementsInfo/{childAgreementsInfoFileId} endpoint.

fileType.description: Input type through which participantSetsInfos will be provided. Whichever input type is provided, the values should be provided in its corresponding value object. Currently we are supporting CSV file format for providing Send in Bulk child recipients.

transientDocumentId.description: Transient id of the input file which contains participantSetsInfos. Currently only csv format is suppported. More details about CSV format here

ccs.description: A list of one or more CCs that will be copied in the bulk send transaction. The CCs will each receive an email at the beginning of the transaction and also when the final document is signed. The email addresses will also receive a copy of the document, attached as a PDF file

childAgreementsInfo.description: Info corresponding to each child agreement of the bulk send

createdDate.description: Date when bulk send was created. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

expirationTime.description: Time after which Agreement expires and needs to be signed before it. Format should be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation.

externalId.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried. Note: the externalId value is visible to all participants through the API, so should not be used to contain a sensitive token.

fileInfos.description: A list of one or more files (or references to files) that will be sent out for signature. If more than one file is provided, they will be combined into one PDF before being sent out. Note: Only one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified

firstReminderDelay.description:
Integer which specifies the delay in hours before sending the first reminder.
This is an optional field. The minimum value allowed is 1 hour and the maximum value cant be more than the difference of agreement creation and expiry time of the agreement in hours.
If this is not specified but the reminder frequency is specified, then the first reminder will be sent based on frequency.
i.e. if the reminder is created with frequency specified as daily, the firstReminderDelay will be 24 hours. Cannot be updated in a PUT

id.description: The unique identifier of bulk send

isDocumentRetentionApplied.description: Is document retention applied for this resource.  If provided in POST or PUT, it will simply be ignored.

lastEventDate.description: The date of the last event that occurred for this bulk send.  Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

locale.description: The locale associated with this agreement - specifies the language for the signing page and emails, for example en_US or fr_FR. If none specified, defaults to the language configured for the agreement sender

message.description: An optional message to the participants, describing what is being sent or why their signature is required

name.description: The name of the agreement that will be used to identify it, in emails, website and other places

numChildren.description: The total number of bulk send children associated with the bulk send parent. If provided in POST, it will be ignored. If modified in PUT, it will throw error MODIFYING_IMMUTABLE_FIELDS

participantSetsInfo.description: Information about the bulk send participants set.

postSignOption.description: URL and associated properties for the success page the user will be taken to after completing the signing process

reminderFrequency.description: Optional parameter that sets how often you want to send reminders to the participants. If it is not specified, the default frequency set for the account will be used

securityOption.description: Optional security parameters for the bulk send

senderEmail.description: Email of agreement sender. Only provided in GET. Can not be provided in POST/PUT request. If provided in POST/PUT, it will be ignored

signatureType.description:
Specifies the type of signature you would like to request - written or e-signature. The possible values are
ESIGN : Agreement needs to be signed electronically
, WRITTEN : Agreement will be signed using handwritten signature and signed document will be uploaded into the system

vaultingInfo.description: Vaulting properties that allows Acrobat Sign to securely store documents with a vault provider

MegaSignCreationResponse.description: A JSON that contains the id of the newly created bulk send

id.description: Unique identifier of the bulk send parent agreement

MegaSignFormFields.description: A JSON list of all of the fields for a bulk send parent agreement.

fields.description: List of the form fields in an agreement

ccs.description: A list of one or more CCs that will be copied in the bulk send transaction. The CCs will each receive an email at the beginning of the transaction and also when the final document is signed. The email addresses will also receive a copy of the document, attached as a PDF file

childAgreementsInfo.description: Info corresponding to each child agreement of the bulk send

createdDate.description: Date when bulk send was created. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

expirationTime.description: Time after which Agreement expires and needs to be signed before it. Format should be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation.

externalId.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried. Note: the externalId value is visible to all participants through the API, so should not be used to contain a sensitive token.

fileInfos.description: A list of one or more files (or references to files) that will be sent out for signature. If more than one file is provided, they will be combined into one PDF before being sent out. Note: Only one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified

firstReminderDelay.description:
Integer which specifies the delay in hours before sending the first reminder.
This is an optional field. The minimum value allowed is 1 hour and the maximum value cant be more than the difference of agreement creation and expiry time of the agreement in hours.
If this is not specified but the reminder frequency is specified, then the first reminder will be sent based on frequency.
i.e. if the reminder is created with frequency specified as daily, the firstReminderDelay will be 24 hours. Cannot be updated in a PUT

groupId.description: The unique identifier of the group to which the bulk send will belong to when it is created. If it is not provided during agreement creation the primary group of the creator will be used

id.description: The unique identifier of bulk send

isDocumentRetentionApplied.description: Is document retention applied for this resource.  If provided in POST or PUT, it will simply be ignored.

lastEventDate.description: The date of the last event that occurred for this bulk send.  Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

locale.description: The locale associated with this agreement - specifies the language for the signing page and emails, for example en_US or fr_FR. If none specified, defaults to the language configured for the agreement sender

message.description: An optional message to the participants, describing what is being sent or why their signature is required

name.description: The name of the agreement that will be used to identify it, in emails, website and other places

numChildren.description: The total number of bulk send children associated with the bulk send parent. If provided in POST, it will be ignored. If modified in PUT, it will throw error MODIFYING_IMMUTABLE_FIELDS

participantSetsInfo.description: Information about the bulk send participants set.

postSignOption.description: URL and associated properties for the success page the user will be taken to after completing the signing process

reminderFrequency.description: Optional parameter that sets how often you want to send reminders to the participants. If it is not specified, the default frequency set for the account will be used

securityOption.description: Optional security parameters for the bulk send

senderEmail.description: Email of agreement sender. Only provided in GET. Can not be provided in POST/PUT request. If provided in POST/PUT, it will be ignored

signatureType.description:
Specifies the type of signature you would like to request - written or e-signature. The possible values are
ESIGN : Agreement needs to be signed electronically
, WRITTEN : Agreement will be signed using handwritten signature and signed document will be uploaded into the system

vaultingInfo.description: Vaulting properties that allows Acrobat Sign to securely store documents with a vault provider

ccsInfo.description: Information of CC participants of the bulk send.

senderInfo.description: Information of the sender of the bulk send.

sharesInfo.description: Information of the participants with whom the bulk send has been shared.

reminderInfoList.description: A list of one or more reminders created on the bulk send parent specified by the unique identifier megasignId by the user invoking the API.

externalAuthenticationMethod.description: The authentication method for the participants to have access to view and sign the document.

externalPassword.description: The secondary password that will be used to protect signing the document for internal signers. Note that Acrobat Sign will never show this password to anyone, so you will need to separately communicate it to any relevant parties. This password is applied only if password protection is specified for internal signers or all signers

internalAuthenticationMethod.description: The authentication method for the participants to have access to view and sign the document.

internalPassword.description: The secondary password that will be used to protect signing the document for external signers. Note that Acrobat Sign will never show this password to anyone, so you will need to separately communicate it to any relevant parties. This password is applied only if password protection is specified for external signers or all signers

openPassword.description: The secondary password that will be used to secure the PDF document. Note that Acrobat Sign will never show this password to anyone, so you will need to separately communicate it to any relevant parties

megaSignCancellationInfo.description: Cancellation information for the agreement. Mandatory while cancelling a bulk send

state.description: The state to which the bulk send is to be updated

embeddedCode.description: Embedded code of url of resource

isCurrent.description: True if this view is the current view

name.description: Name of the requested bulk send view

commonViewConfiguration.description: Common view configuration for all the available views

name.description: Name of the requested bulk send view

megaSignList.description: An array of Send in Bulk parent agreements

page.description: Pagination information for navigating through the response

actingUserEmail.description: Email address of the user that created the event

actingUserIpAddress.description: The IP address of the user that created the event

actingUserName.description: The name of the acting user

comment.description: The event comment. For RECALLED or REJECTED, the reason given by the user that initiates the event. For DELEGATE or SHARE, the message from the acting user to the participant

date.description: The date of the audit event. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

description.description: A description of the audit event

device.description: The device used for the event.

deviceLocation.description: Location of the device that generated the event (This value may be null due to limited privileges)

devicePhoneNumber.description: Phone number from the device used when the participation is completed on a mobile phone

digitalSignatureInfo.description: This is present for ESIGNED events when the participation is signed digitally

initiatingUserEmail.description: Email address of the user that initiated the event on behalf of the acting user when the account is shared. Will be empty if there is no account sharing in effect

initiatingUserName.description: Full name of the user that initiated the event on behalf of the acting user when the account is shared. Will be empty if there is no account sharing in effect

participantEmail.description: Email address of the user that is the participant for the event. This may be different than the acting user for certain event types. For example, for a DELEGATION event, this is the user who was delegated to

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the participant for the event. This may be different than the acting user for certain event types. For example, for a DELEGATION event, this is the user who was delegated to

participantRole.description: Role assumed by all participants in the participant set the participant belongs to (signer, approver etc.).

reminderParticipants.description: A list of one or more participants who received the reminders

replacedParticipantEmail.description: Email of the user that was replaced by the participant for the event. This may be different than the acting user for certain event types. For example, for a DELEGATION event, this is the user who was delegated to

replacedParticipantName.description: Full name of the user that was replaced by the participant for the event. This may be different than the acting user for certain event types. For example, for a DELEGATION event, this is the user who was delegated to

signerNewName.description: Signer changed name at signing : new name used to sign.

signerOldName.description: Signer changed name at signing : name used previous to signing.

signingReason.description: Signing reason captured during ESIGN or DIGSIGN

synchronizationId.description: A unique identifier linking offline events to synchronization events (specified for offline signing events and synchronization events, else null)

vaultEventId.description: The identifier assigned by the vault provider for the vault event (if vaulted, otherwise null)

vaultProviderName.description: Name of the vault provider for the vault event (if vaulted, otherwise null)

versionId.description: An ID which uniquely identifies the version of the document associated with this audit event

accountSharers.description: A list of account sharer in relation to the api caller and this resource.

nextCursor.description: Used to navigate to the next page. If notreturned, there are no further pages.

authenticationMethod.description: The authentication method for the participants to have access to view and sign the document. When replacing a participant that has PASSWORD or PHONE authentication specified, you must supply a password or phone number for the new participant, and you cannot change the authentication method

notaryAuthentication.description: The authentication method of the notary participant to the notary

password.description: The password required for the participant to view and sign the document. Note that Acrobat Sign will never show this password to anyone, so you will need to separately communicate it to any relevant parties. The password will not be returned in GET call. When replacing a participant that has PASSWORD authentication specified, you must supply a password for the new participant.

phoneInfo.description: The phoneInfo required for the participant to view and sign the document

countryCode.description: The numeric country calling code (ISD code) required for the participant to view and sign the document if authentication type is PHONE

countryIsoCode.description: The country ISO Alpha-2 code required for the participant to view and sign the document if authentication method is PHONE

phone.description: The phone number required for the participant to view and sign the document if authentication method is PHONE. When replacing a participant that has PHONE authentication specified, you must supply a phone number for the new participant.

redirectDelay.description: The delay (in seconds) before the user is taken to the success page. If this value is greater than 0, the user will first see the standard Acrobat Sign success message, and then after a delay will be redirected to your success page

redirectUrl.description: A publicly accessible url to which the user will be sent after successfully completing the signing process

id.description: An identifier of the reminder resource created on the server. If provided in POST or PUT, it will be ignored

allUnsigned.description: If true, set a reminder on all participants (non-CCs and non-sharees) that still need to sign the bulk send agreement

firstReminderDelay.description:
Integer which specifies the delay in hours before sending the first reminder.
This is an optional field. The minimum value allowed is 1 hour and the maximum value cant be more than the difference of agreement creation and expiry time of the agreement in hours.
If this is not specified but the reminder frequency is specified, then the first reminder will be sent based on frequency.
i.e. if the reminder is created with frequency specified as daily, the firstReminderDelay will be 24 hours. Cannot be updated in a PUT

frequency.description:
The frequency at which reminder will be sent until the agreement is completed.
If frequency is not provided, the reminder will be sent once (if the agreement is available at the specified time) with the delay based on the firstReminderDelay field and will never repeat again. If the agreement is not available at that time, reminder will not be sent. Cannot be updated in a PUT

lastSentDate.description: The date when the reminder was last sent. Only provided in GET. Cannot be provided in POST request. If provided in POST, it will be ignored. Cannot be updated in a PUT. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

nextSentDate.description: The date when the reminder is scheduled to be sent next. When provided in POST request, frequency needs to be ONCE (or not specified), startReminderCounterFrom needs to be REMINDER_CREATION (or not specified) and firstReminderDelay needs to be 0 (or not specified). Cannot be updated in a PUT. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

note.description: An optional message sent to the recipients, describing why their participation is required

recipientParticipantIds.description: A list of one or more participant IDs that the reminder should be sent to. These must be sharees or cc's on the bulk send. In order to remind any other participant who has not signed, use the allUnsigned boolean parameter.

reminderId.description: An identifier of the reminder resource created on the server. If provided in POST or PUT, it will be ignored

startReminderCounterFrom.description:
Reminder can be sent based on when the agreement becomes available or when the reminder is created
AGREEMENT_AVAILABILITY: If the agreement is not available to the participant at the time of reminder creation, the reminder will be sent for the first time, only when the agreement becomes available to the participant taking the firstReminderDelay into account. Subsequent reminders will be sent based on the frequency specified. If the agreement is already available to the participant at the time of reminder creation, the first reminder will be sent after the delay specified by firstReminderDelay from the reminder creation time.
REMINDER_CREATION: The first reminder will be sent after the delay specified by firstReminderDelay from the reminder creation time only if the agreement is available at that time. Subsequent reminders will be triggered based on the frequency specified and will be sent only if the agreement is available at that time. For agreements in authoring state, creating reminder with startReminderCounterFrom as REMINDER_CREATION is not allowed.
Note : If firstReminderDelay, frequency and startReminderCounterFrom fields are not specified in POST, reminder will be sent right now if the agreement is available. If agreement is not available, an error will be thrown. Cannot be updated in a PUT

status.description: Current status of the reminder.  The only valid update in a PUT is from ACTIVE to CANCELED.  Must be provided as ACTIVE in a POST.

email.description: The email address of the participant

name.description: The full name of the participant

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the participant

company.description: Company of the sender of the bulk send, if available.

createdDate.description: The date when the sender was added. This will be returned as part of GET call but is ignored if passed as part of PUT call.

email.description: Email of the sender of the bulk send.

hidden.description: True if the bulk send is hidden for the user that is calling the API. Only returned if self is true.

name.description: Name of the sender of the bulk send, if available.

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the sender of the bulk send.

self.description: True if the sender of the bulk send is the same user that is calling the API.

status.description: The bulk send status with respect to the participant set.

userId.description: The user ID of the sender. This will be returned as part of GET call but is ignored if passed as part of PUT call.

email.description: The email address of the member with whom the agreement will be shared
The email address that was requested

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the participant

company.description: Company of the sharee participant of the bulk send, if available.

email.description: Email of the sharee participant of the bulk send.

hidden.description: True if the bulk send parent is hidden for the user that is calling the API. Only returned if self is true.

name.description: Name of the sharee participant of the bulk send, if available.

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the sharee participant of the bulk send.

self.description: True if the Share participant of the bulk send is the same user that is calling the API.

sharerParticipantId.description: The unique identifier of the participant who shared the bulk send.

mimeType.description: The mime type of the referenced file, used to determine if the file can be accepted and the necessary conversion steps can be performed

name.description: The original system file name of the document being sent

url.description: A publicly accessible URL for retrieving the raw file content

enabled.description: For accounts set up for document vaulting and the option to enable per agreement, this determines whether the document is to be vaulted

visibility.description: Specifies the visibility. The possible values are HIDE or SHOW
